name: zig-waybar-contrib
description: ⚡ High-performance Waybar modules written in Zig for efficient system monitoring
readme:
> [!IMPORTANT] > This repository has been migrated to [codeberg.org](https://codeberg.org/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib)
> **This repository is not mirrored.** #### Zig moved its codebase to Codeberg hit me like a wake-up slap: why keep hosting my project in Microsoft’s digital landfill when genuinely open, community-driven platforms actually exist?

**Note: With this update I stop sharing binaries via GitHub Releases, please use the AUR package or compile your own.**

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib/compare/1.0.16...1.1.0
- Refer to [CHANGELOG](https://github.com/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)


**Note: The following `gpu` binary was compiled with `rocm-smi-lib`, if you try to use it with `amdsmi` installed you will not be able to use it.**

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib/compare/1.0.15...1.0.16

### What's Changed
- **refactor(gpu)**: Replace `sysfs` backend with `rocm-smi-lib` for improved compatibility and performance  
- **chore(release)**: Bump version to `1.0.16`  
- **chore(license)**: Add per-file `LICENSE` notices (GPL-3.0)

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib/compare/1.0.14...1.0.15

### What's Changed
- **feat(ping)**: Add Waybar signal implementation  
- **refactor(network)**: Change signal to `14`  
- **chore(release)**: Bump version to `1.0.15`

> **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/erffy/zig-waybar-contrib/compare/1.0.13b...1.0.14

### What's Changed
- **refactor**: Update signal handling logic  
- **feat(ping)**: Change default target to AdGuard DNS  
- **fix(updates)**: Correct stdout message formatting  
- **chore(build)**: Remove `libc` dependency  
- **feat(core)**: Add utility to fetch Waybar PID  
- **feat(signals)**: Implement native Waybar signaling using Zig stdlib
